data.what_is:
With SuperOffice CRM, our goal is to help companies create sustainable customer relationships.

Relationships have always been at the heart of our CRM solution. Whether it is building relationships with customers or with colleagues, SuperOffice connects people through technology and helps them achieve more.

Through our CRM technology, know-how and experience, we inspire and empower B2B professionals to anticipate customer needs and to serve and delight customers.
data.product_description: CRM SoftwareCompanies choose SuperOffice to help them build long-lasting customer relationships and generate higher and more sustainable revenue.Striving to be more than a cloud CRM provider, we serve as a trusted partner to B2B companies in Europe that want to streamline their processes, become customer-centric and achieve more.With more than 30 years of CRM experience and a commitment to data security, we have the knowledge, expertise and insight to help you throughout your entire CRM journey.

features.name: Customization
features.content: As reported in 23 SuperOffice CRM reviews. Allows administrators to customize to accomodate their unique processes.  Includes ability to create custom objects, fields, rules, calculations, and views.

features.name: Workflow Capability
features.content: As reported in 19 SuperOffice CRM reviews. Automates a process that requires a series of steps that typically require intervention by a several different users.  Administrators can write rules to determine who and when a user needs to complete a step.  Also includes notification of users when they need to take action.

features.name: User, Role, and Access Management
features.content: As reported in 25 SuperOffice CRM reviews. Grant access to select data, features, objects, etc. based on the users, user role, groups, etc.

features.name: Internationalization
features.content: Enables users to view and transact business with the same content in multiple languages and currencies. 18 reviewers of SuperOffice CRM have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Sandbox / Test Environments
features.content: Allows administrators to easily develop and test changes to the CRM deployment.  After changes are made admins can easily migrate the changes into the "live" or "production" environment.  This feature was mentioned in 16 SuperOffice CRM reviews.

features.name: Document & Content Mgmt.
features.content: Allows consuming, publishing and editing content from a central interface.  Content management for CRM systems might include presentations, documents, images and other related electronic files. This feature was mentioned in 19 SuperOffice CRM reviews.

features.name: Performance and Reliability
features.content: Software is consistently available (uptime) and allows users to complete tasks quickly because they are not waiting for the software to respond to an action they took.  26 reviewers of SuperOffice CRM have provided feedback on this feature.

features.name: Output Document Generation
features.content: Allows adminstrators to create templates that enable users to quickly generate dynamic documents in various formats based on the data stored in the application. 22 reviewers of SuperOffice CRM have provided feedback on this feature.

features.content: As reported in 31 SuperOffice CRM reviews. Allows users to create a quote to be provided to a customer that contain at least products, prices and associated discounts.  Order management allows users to process orders that contain products, prices and associated discounts.

features.content: Management of contracts made with customers. features.content: Allows users to send email to contacts in bulk. features.content: As reported in 30 SuperOffice CRM reviews. Optimizes the process for organizations to develop and deploy multiple-channel marketing campaigns to target groups or individuals and track the effect of those campaigns, by customer segment, over time.

features.name: Lead Management
features.content: Based on 36 SuperOffice CRM reviews. Allows users to manage and track leads though a process.  The lead process typically involves steps such as:  1. Lead Generation, 2. Customer Inquiry, Inquiry Capture, Lead Filtering, Lead Grading, Lead Distribution and Lead Qualification.

initial_reviews.review_title: SuperOffice helps us in both control and create an overview for the whole organization
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
SuperOffice Online is a very relible system that fits our needs with more than 400 users. In its current version it is highly configurable and adaptiv. The dashboard module has helped us a lot to create business process driven overviews for each department within the organization. The best feature is the ticket handling system and we handle 2000 tickets per day.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
The only downside is its uniqe user interface that need som explanation and adoption to really understand. But when you learn how things is organized you really appriciate its flexibility.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
Overview of all interaction with our customers and members. We really managed to get away from person centric handling of questions and support to our customers

initial_reviews.review_title: A great CRM for customiseable permissions for users, lacks a bit on the Marketing side.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
I enjoy the great possibilities to customise the system for individual users, I work with marketing but also back-end SuperOffice as the "Go to guy" to solve issues or user rights. The UI is built in an okay way, it feels a bit outdated at times but its simple to use once you get the hang of it. Feels like it's quite a steep entry level, but once you have it in the bag its easy.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
There's not anything Major that I dislike about SuperOffice, all the Sales, Company cards, Contact cards etc are fine and no additions needed in my opinion, I would like to see more improvement made on the Marketing side. Better possibilities to create more nuance newsletters, the tool is in my opinion a bit outdated compared to what exists today. There's no full drag & drop, its still kind of locked in that sense and images don't crop the way I want to. At the end of the day there's quite a lot of work needed to be done to images you want to attach, before you attach them, otherwise they will look messed up. I would take inspiration from Squarespace and the way you build websites on their platform, it's basically a grid where you can resize/move things as you please.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reaching customers with newsletters, A tool for our salesreps to store data, follow up sale statistics, keeping track of customer data

The UI is built in an okay way, it feels a bit outdated at times but its simple to use once you get the hang of it. Feels like it's quite a steep entry level, but once you have it in the bag its easy.

review_question_answers.answer: There's not anything Major that I dislike about SuperOffice, all the Sales, Company cards, Contact cards etc are fine and no additions needed in my opinion, I would like to see more improvement made on the Marketing side. Better possibilities to create more nuance newsletters, the tool is in my opinion a bit outdated compared to what exists today. There's no full drag & drop, its still kind of locked in that sense and images don't crop the way I want to. At the end of the day there's quite a lot of work needed to be done to images you want to attach, before you attach them, otherwise they will look messed up. I would take inspiration from Squarespace and the way you build websites on their platform, it's basically a grid where you can resize/move things as you please.

review_question_answers.answer: Reaching customers with newsletters, A tool for our salesreps to store data, follow up sale statistics, keeping track of customer data

initial_reviews.review_title: Very capable CRM for Sales and Service - and to get a joint picture of the customer base
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
We are using SuperOffice Service to handle requests from our customers in an efficient way. To be able to easily set up templates and create an effective workflow for consultants working with tickets is great, as well as the ability to measure answer times etc and get intuitive dashboards. Easy to integrate to other related systems.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
Maybe that the user interface could be a little more intuitive and require less clicks to get stuff done.
Customer support is a little split between the SO consultant and the support team which can be a bit confusing.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
To efficiently handle all incoming customer tickets/questions.

initial_reviews.review_title: Intuitive and great support
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
Superoffice is easy to learn for users. GUI is clean and intuitive. The integration with MS Office lets the user be in control of what and how to create and archive documents.

The support from Superoffice is very good. I have used Superoffice since 1997 but have sometimes been forced to use other CRM systems. I will stick to Superoffice.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
Cloud version is a bit slow in updating the browser and there is a tendency to open new tabs.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
Never forget a customer! For every customer interaction, plan the next activity in Superoffice. This is basic, but very hard to achieve by using Excel, Outlook, Teams, and other home-brewed solutions. With a very simple structure, resources can be planned and effectiveness can be analyzed.

initial_reviews.review_title: SuperOffice Online for a large organization
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
The user-friendliness of the GUI in Sales. The core functions are easy to use and all features (there are a lot) are "hidden" and don't confuse the user.
One of the best featueres is "current active" meaning that when you switch from one module (company/ sale/ project/ diary)  to another, the system "knows" what related objects is active, meaning that you do not need to search for the same same object again. Saves a lot of time

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
The Service module is not as user-friendly (yet) and it needs a bit of explaining before the user can use its full potential.
As announced, there is a new GUI on its way for Service, much more like Sales today

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
SuperOffice CRM gives a full overview of our interaction towards customers, prospects, members, contracts, sales together with views and integrations with our ERP and master data application. It is probably the most used application for our 450+ users after Teams. Request handling is the most important part of the system as we handle 2500 requests /tickets) a day originating from Emails, forms on our websites, phone (integrated with SuperOffice CRM) and of course internal requests.
SuperOffice Service as our primary channel for handling customer related request (internal and external) instead of using internal mails or Team chat.  The Outlook plugin that creates a request without forwarding is a great help to achive this.

initial_reviews.review_title: SuperOffice CRM streamlines our communication
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
The entire customer history is centrally stored and can be viewed in an overview at the touch of a button. Because the telephone exchange is also linked to SuperOffice, they save a lot of time when calling tasks and quotations. Even when the customer calls them, they see who is calling and they immediately see the correct customer card. This way of customer recognition ensures a proactive attitude on the part of the employees, which the customer appreciates. Thanks to the central agenda function, everyone now knows exactly what each other is doing. SuperOffice is, in addition to the ERP system, crucial for Elincom Electronics. That is why a link has been developed between the ERP system and SuperOffice. All price agreements, articles and current orders can be consulted in SuperOffice CRM.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
We started with the windows version with travel function a long time ago. We have been on the online version for some time now and we are still getting used to the fact that we no longer have an off-line database with us for a customer visit. The advantage of online is that you look at the latest data.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
A simple way to let salespeople communicate with their customers. Due to the link with our ERP with web screens in Superoffice, there is no need from sales to have access to the ERP system. Everything is visible in Superoffice.

initial_reviews.review_title: CRM and Project Manangement in ONE!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
Although it is a CRM system in the first place, we have challenged SO to help structuring the system in such a way to enable using it for our project management as well. We were using SO as a tool for project management, but wanted to work more according Prince2 principles. With the SO online version and the dedicated help of the SO team we have re-structured in such a way that we are able to process and our customer projects in an efficient way and have the opportunity to visualise the project follow up in a nice dashboard cockpit.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
Nothing in particular. We have been working with the SO project team in close cooperation, leaving room for discussions and helpful input from the SO consultants.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
We wanted to have a combined solution for CRM and project management. Having that in one application, we can combine customer information and project progress in one overview.

initial_reviews.review_title: Long term user of SuperOffice
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
For day-to-day use retaining customer information whether it is a new sales inquiry or a customer service request SuperOffice works straight out of the box. We have been using this CRM for over twenty years and have seen the product develop and take advantage of the new technologies and operating systems to where we are today with a cloud-based system. Our users are comfortable using the system in-house or from home meaning that we have very little stress in keeping the workflow running smoothly.
Third-party support is nice to have, we have used a number of third-party apps over the years.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
For the ways that we use SuperOffice and considering how long we have been using the product we don't dislike anything strongly enough to say we dislike it, after its software, and if you shout loud enough someone will make the changes you need.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
We don't have problems only opportunities, We like the Marketing tools right now and they assist us in sending informative newsletters to specific groups of customers.

initial_reviews.review_title: Easy to use covers the needs to keep track on business
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
It is easy to archive emails and documents, and the new option is that you can add your own fields. Superoffice customer support is fast to reply and professional. Superoffice makes it easy to go digital as documents can be easily dropped, stored, and previewed.
The superoffice mobile app is great on the road.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
To copy projects is a wish we hope soon will be implemented.
You cannot search department directly under Company a modification said will come soon.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
Keeping track of sales leads and projects. The Marketing function is very useful for sending out invitations to exhibitions, as you can tailor the email text and use pictures. The receiver of marketing emails can address the acceptance whether receiving emails or not all in accordance with the GDPR requirements, which is well taken care of in Superoffice. If emails fail to reach the receiver it is indicated on the contact level with an error message for correction.
The Dashboard is very powerful and flexible you can configure it for your needs giving a good picture of the progress of sales efforts, leads, quotes, and pending follow-ups.

initial_reviews.review_title: User friendly software and excellent customer support
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
Superoffice has made everything much easier to track down previous sales/correspondence. The team was able to build a customised CRM that includes all of the relevant segments of the business to ensure that everything remained organised and fluent from adding a new customer to quoting and aftersales care. The team, Karl Griffiths specifically, goes above and beyond with our many phone calls asking for advice (despite receiving detailed and helpful training).  The sales team truly does have the ultimate patience.   The different features for pulling reports and collecting customers who haven't been called/emailed within a time period saved an awful lot of time in comparison to our old practices.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
It would be great to be able to open up customer profiles using a right-click option, rather than having to open a new tab and search through the CRM by company name.

Recommendations to others considering SuperOffice CRM:
- Speak to the team about your process and needs, they will help you design the CRM to work for you
- Utilise the training offered

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Time taken to search through previous customer correspondence was reduced drastically
- Chasing up quotations (some had been lost in our old system and not chased up)
-  Pulling up reports to ensure all customers are being contacted and targeted
- Mail merges (we hadn't focused on this before and it has really helped us gain exposure)
- Events - seeing what benefits and gains of sales we had from certain events by simply attaching that quotation to the event created in the CRM
- Sales support offered by the Superoffice team to help us streamline our process further and even offer advice on different aspects that we were missing out on before

all_reviews.review_title: A great CRM for customiseable permissions for users, lacks a bit on the Marketing side.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
I enjoy the great possibilities to customise the system for individual users, I work with marketing but also back-end SuperOffice as the "Go to guy" to solve issues or user rights. The UI is built in an okay way, it feels a bit outdated at times but its simple to use once you get the hang of it. Feels like it's quite a steep entry level, but once you have it in the bag its easy.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
There's not anything Major that I dislike about SuperOffice, all the Sales, Company cards, Contact cards etc are fine and no additions needed in my opinion, I would like to see more improvement made on the Marketing side. Better possibilities to create more nuance newsletters, the tool is in my opinion a bit outdated compared to what exists today. There's no full drag & drop, its still kind of locked in that sense and images don't crop the way I want to. At the end of the day there's quite a lot of work needed to be done to images you want to attach, before you attach them, otherwise they will look messed up. I would take inspiration from Squarespace and the way you build websites on their platform, it's basically a grid where you can resize/move things as you please.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
Reaching customers with newsletters, A tool for our salesreps to store data, follow up sale statistics, keeping track of customer data

The support from Superoffice is very good. I have used Superoffice since 1997 but have sometimes been forced to use other CRM systems. I will stick to Superoffice.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
Cloud version is a bit slow in updating the browser and there is a tendency to open new tabs.

Never forget a customer! For every customer interaction, plan the next activity in Superoffice. This is basic, but very hard to achieve by using Excel, Outlook, Teams, and other home-brewed solutions. With a very simple structure, resources can be planned and effectiveness can be analyzed.

all_reviews.review_title: SuperOffice Online for a large organization
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
The user-friendliness of the GUI in Sales. The core functions are easy to use and all features (there are a lot) are "hidden" and don't confuse the user.
One of the best featueres is "current active" meaning that when you switch from one module (company/ sale/ project/ diary)  to another, the system "knows" what related objects is active, meaning that you do not need to search for the same same object again. Saves a lot of time

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
The Service module is not as user-friendly (yet) and it needs a bit of explaining before the user can use its full potential.
As announced, there is a new GUI on its way for Service, much more like Sales today

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
SuperOffice CRM gives a full overview of our interaction towards customers, prospects, members, contracts, sales together with views and integrations with our ERP and master data application. It is probably the most used application for our 450+ users after Teams. Request handling is the most important part of the system as we handle 2500 requests /tickets) a day originating from Emails, forms on our websites, phone (integrated with SuperOffice CRM) and of course internal requests.
SuperOffice Service as our primary channel for handling customer related request (internal and external) instead of using internal mails or Team chat.  The Outlook plugin that creates a request without forwarding is a great help to achive this.

all_reviews.review_title: SuperOffice CRM streamlines our communication
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
The entire customer history is centrally stored and can be viewed in an overview at the touch of a button. Because the telephone exchange is also linked to SuperOffice, they save a lot of time when calling tasks and quotations. Even when the customer calls them, they see who is calling and they immediately see the correct customer card. This way of customer recognition ensures a proactive attitude on the part of the employees, which the customer appreciates. Thanks to the central agenda function, everyone now knows exactly what each other is doing. SuperOffice is, in addition to the ERP system, crucial for Elincom Electronics. That is why a link has been developed between the ERP system and SuperOffice. All price agreements, articles and current orders can be consulted in SuperOffice CRM.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
We started with the windows version with travel function a long time ago. We have been on the online version for some time now and we are still getting used to the fact that we no longer have an off-line database with us for a customer visit. The advantage of online is that you look at the latest data.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
A simple way to let salespeople communicate with their customers. Due to the link with our ERP with web screens in Superoffice, there is no need from sales to have access to the ERP system. Everything is visible in Superoffice.

all_reviews.review_title: CRM and Project Manangement in ONE!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
Although it is a CRM system in the first place, we have challenged SO to help structuring the system in such a way to enable using it for our project management as well. We were using SO as a tool for project management, but wanted to work more according Prince2 principles. With the SO online version and the dedicated help of the SO team we have re-structured in such a way that we are able to process and our customer projects in an efficient way and have the opportunity to visualise the project follow up in a nice dashboard cockpit.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
Nothing in particular. We have been working with the SO project team in close cooperation, leaving room for discussions and helpful input from the SO consultants.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
We wanted to have a combined solution for CRM and project management. Having that in one application, we can combine customer information and project progress in one overview.

all_reviews.review_title: Long term user of SuperOffice
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
For day-to-day use retaining customer information whether it is a new sales inquiry or a customer service request SuperOffice works straight out of the box. We have been using this CRM for over twenty years and have seen the product develop and take advantage of the new technologies and operating systems to where we are today with a cloud-based system. Our users are comfortable using the system in-house or from home meaning that we have very little stress in keeping the workflow running smoothly.
Third-party support is nice to have, we have used a number of third-party apps over the years.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
For the ways that we use SuperOffice and considering how long we have been using the product we don't dislike anything strongly enough to say we dislike it, after its software, and if you shout loud enough someone will make the changes you need.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
We don't have problems only opportunities, We like the Marketing tools right now and they assist us in sending informative newsletters to specific groups of customers.

The Dashboard is very powerful and flexible you can configure it for your needs giving a good picture of the progress of sales efforts, leads, quotes, and pending follow-ups.

all_reviews.review_title: User friendly software and excellent customer support
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
Superoffice has made everything much easier to track down previous sales/correspondence. The team was able to build a customised CRM that includes all of the relevant segments of the business to ensure that everything remained organised and fluent from adding a new customer to quoting and aftersales care. The team, Karl Griffiths specifically, goes above and beyond with our many phone calls asking for advice (despite receiving detailed and helpful training).  The sales team truly does have the ultimate patience.   The different features for pulling reports and collecting customers who haven't been called/emailed within a time period saved an awful lot of time in comparison to our old practices.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
It would be great to be able to open up customer profiles using a right-click option, rather than having to open a new tab and search through the CRM by company name.

Recommendations to others considering SuperOffice CRM:
- Speak to the team about your process and needs, they will help you design the CRM to work for you
- Utilise the training offered

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
- Time taken to search through previous customer correspondence was reduced drastically
- Chasing up quotations (some had been lost in our old system and not chased up)
-  Pulling up reports to ensure all customers are being contacted and targeted
- Mail merges (we hadn't focused on this before and it has really helped us gain exposure)
- Events - seeing what benefits and gains of sales we had from certain events by simply attaching that quotation to the event created in the CRM
- Sales support offered by the Superoffice team to help us streamline our process further and even offer advice on different aspects that we were missing out on before

all_reviews.review_title: A great addition to the daily sales routine
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
- With Superoffice, the sales consultant has a tool at hand that allows him to optimally plan his workday.
- When at the customer's site, it is possible to quickly find all the information related to the customer's profile or a specific order and discuss it with the customer.
- Thanks to the adjustable dashboard, the sales management can make certain KPI's directly available to the sales consultant.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
- The task management should be better. Collaboration on a task is sometimes difficult and confusing.
- The search function in the mobile app leaves much to be desired and cannot be compared with the search function in the browser version.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
- All information available at one central point.
- Lists of activities are very clear and can be found quickly.
- Employees find their way around the system very quickly.

Further more processes and data storage was not easy to handle as the setup of GDPR guidleines in Microsoft took a whole lot more time and money and we even felt not being on a secure level. The detup of an own customer centre in Superoffice is pretty easy and fast. Superoffice at all is easy to use.

We have benefitted strongly in transparency, sustainability and sales boost.

all_reviews.review_title: The only way to manage your business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
I like that I can have access to all the elements I require as a business. Sales, marketing and service. With most of our team working remotely, being able to see what we are doing, the latest status of our events and what communications are going out gives us a competitive advantage in keeping us lean.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
The least favourite part is the mailings editor, the tool itself is VERY powerful for actioning tasks within the CRM, but lets itself down with the old content manager. I have been assured that a new more modern drag and drop editor is on its way, so for me this would make it near perfect!

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use SuperOffice for all aspects of our business, managing sales pipeline, providing us a place or event management in the projects area and handling incoming enquiries in the service module. We even managed to use the app store to link Eventbrite to SuperOffice for attendee registration and data capture!

all_reviews.review_title: Feature rich and easy to use.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
Simplicity is its best feature. Each area is self explanatory and easy to use. The project management is something we take advantage of a lot and without it the company would find it difficult to do business as quickly as we currently do. The platform is very reliable and very rarely requires additional support to keep operating. The web based interface eliminates additional software installations and works seamlessly at home and in the office.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
Although simple, the user interface feels a little dated and the marketing tools are lacking (think automation). I am told automation is coming or is available via add-ons but I feel this should be a standard integration for the CRM. Upgrade paths on the on-site version limits the experience and the hosted platform gets access to an apps market for easy integrations with other services. Some features are also hosted only which restricts our ability to take advantage of emerging trends within CRM solutions.

Recommendations to others considering SuperOffice CRM:
Easy and simple to deploy. Currently the upgrade cycle is faster and deployed more quickly on their hosted CRM so if you want current updates and access to their apps market, this is the way for you.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
Customer account management, archiving email conversations and specialised project management between three parties is the main benefit for our company. We have been using SuperOffice well for over six years and the program has remained consistent which has allowed our team to get the most from the platform without too much additional training after each software upgrade. We have transitioned to a work from home model due to the current pandemic and thankfully our on-prem model allowed us to achieve this ahead of time without too much modification.

all_reviews.review_title: The power of a suite
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
Combine all information on one platform like CRM (company, contact, addresses), Sales (prospects and closed sales), Tickets (questions & answers automatically combined in one ticket), schedule (of all employees), marketing & newsletters  and queries/statistics on all modules.
That's sharing information together in one environment!
All hosted on a stable platform, good response times and  good support for GDRP (also because it's all on one platform).
Not to forget the solid integration with Office-365 with Calendar synchronization and plug-in to file/store the mails in SuperOffice itself (not only a link!).

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
We would even like to have the power of Outlook mail & calendar within SuperOffice (within the suite, not switching & archiving with the external Outlook),
although we recognize and confirm that Outlook is one of the best mail-clients, almost impossible to be improved by SuperOffice.

Recommendations to others considering SuperOffice CRM:
Some integrations with VAT-checks (VIES Europe) and international Chamber of Commerce checks (or credit check companies like CreditSafe) would be nice.  And we would be very happy with an integration with LeadInfo and a cheaper Linkedin-plugin ;-)

all_reviews.review_title: Brilliant CRM Software
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
SuperOffice CRM enables us to build a complete record of all details and communications with our contacts.  No longer do we need to trawl through aged emails to find past communications, including those sent and received by colleagues.

The system is great for sending personalised mailings to large groups, with the ability to see which recipients have read them.  Features include projects and selections (static and dynamic), which enable targeting of relevant contacts for mailings.

Many of the required fields are already in the system, but there is the capacity to add and personalise fields for the business's own use.  I can't imagine working without it now!

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
It is unfortunate that mailings can sometimes go into a recipient's junk folder - even my own on occasion!

The other slight niggle is that I copy a lot of previous mailings to edit and reuse, and the system doesn't copy over the title, subject or include any attachments from the original mailing, which just creates a little extra work.

Recommendations to others considering SuperOffice CRM:
Check it out!  It's much better than others I have seen.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
As mentioned above, the ability to retain all information on a contact in one place is invaluable.  Prior to getting the system, we had the issue of sending mass mailings, which were limited in the number we could send in one message and also were not personalised to the recipients.

I did previously find it frustrating when looking for a particular email in a contact's details, as it was necessary to download and read all the emails in Outlook.  However, that issue has been resolved in a recent upgrade, and the user can now preview all communications in a window to the side of a contact's details, which is a great feature and saves a lot of time.

Superoffice is as super as its name and it helped me in creating and strengthening relations with my customers. Customer relation is a part and parcel of any business. With SuperOffice  managing customer relations has become quite easy for me. It not only helped me with catching up and getting more customers but also aided in promptly responding to my customers' needs as well. all_reviews.review_title: Easy to use, intuitive to use, modern design
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
Intuitive to use, i like the Marketing module.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
When using the Marketing module, I use selections to e-mail invitations and newsletters. It seems not possible to pick-out (delete) one Person from the selection before mailing. That irritates me...

Recommendations to others considering SuperOffice CRM:
Think in advance what you want to use CRM for and see to what extent SuperOffice can provide this. My experience is that a CRM package can never 100% meet all requirements.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
E-mail invitations and newsletters from one database.

all_reviews.review_title: The GDPR CRM
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about SuperOffice CRM?
A CRM system that really has made the GDPR work so much easier. It helps us to be as professional as we want.

What do you dislike about SuperOffice CRM?
I don't dislike anything, however I really think that they should work on the possibility to follow up better on the sales teams budgets.

Recommendations to others considering SuperOffice CRM:
If you want to have a system that you can implement and don't want to spend so much money on consulting this is the right system.

What problems is SuperOffice CRM solving and how is that benefiting you?
GDPR, and controll of rights to read and use the documents people are allowed to use. And of course control and follow up on the sales activity's.
